Faction.name: {=TAOM_clan_d1}Baedd-lûth
Faction.text: {=TAOM_clan_d1_desc}The Baedd-lûth trace their lineage to the ancient kings of Dunland. Their warriors are known for their ferocity in battle and their hatred of the horse-lords to the south.

Faction.name: {=TAOM_clan_d2}Gwrach-lûth
Faction.text: {=TAOM_clan_d2_desc}The Gwrach-lûth are keepers of the old ways. Their chieftains consult with seers and druids before any battle, and their warriors paint themselves with woad.

Faction.name: {=TAOM_clan_d3}Eryr-lûth
Faction.text: {=TAOM_clan_d3_desc}The Eryr-lûth hold the mountain passes of Dunland. Their warriors are stubborn defenders who never yield ground once taken.

Faction.name: {=TAOM_clan_dale1}House of the River
Faction.text: {=TAOM_clan_dale1_desc}The House of the River controls the trade routes along the Running River. Their wealth comes from the caravans that pass between Dale, Erebor, and the lands beyond.

Faction.name: {=TAOM_clan_dale2}House of the Archers
Faction.text: {=TAOM_clan_dale2_desc}The House of the Archers produces the finest bowmen in Dale. Their longbowmen are legendary for the accuracy of their shots and the range of their weapons.

Faction.name: {=TAOM_clan_dale3}House of Long Lake
Faction.text: {=TAOM_clan_dale3_desc}The House of Long Lake guards the approaches to Esgaroth. Their warriors are trained in defensive warfare and have held the gates against many foes.

Faction.name: {=TAOM_clan_h1}Tribe of the Serpent
Faction.text: {=TAOM_clan_h1_desc}The Tribe of the Serpent rules the central deserts of Harad. Their warriors are renowned for their skill with the curved blades of the South and their deadly poison-tipped arrows.

Faction.name: {=TAOM_clan_h2}Tribe of the Mumakil
Faction.text: {=TAOM_clan_h2_desc}The Tribe of the Mumakil breeds and trains the great war elephants of Far Harad. Their Mumakil are feared by all the enemies of the South.

Faction.name: {=TAOM_clan_h3}Tribe of the Scarlet
Faction.text: {=TAOM_clan_h3_desc}The Tribe of the Scarlet provides the elite bodyguards of the Haradrim lords. Their warriors wear crimson robes and are fanatically loyal to their masters.

Faction.name: {=TAOM_clan_r1}House of Heoruring
Faction.text: {=TAOM_clan_r1_desc}The House of Heoruring has served the Kings of Rohan since the founding of the Mark. Their riders are the finest in all the Riddermark, and their loyalty to the throne is absolute.

Faction.name: {=TAOM_clan_r2}House of Westfolding
Faction.text: {=TAOM_clan_r2_desc}The House of Westfolding guards the Gap of Rohan against Dunlending raids. Their warriors are hardened by constant battle with the hill folk.

Faction.name: {=TAOM_clan_r3}House of Eastemnetring
Faction.text: {=TAOM_clan_r3_desc}The House of Eastemnetring breeds the finest horses in all of Rohan. Their mearas are descended from the legendary Felarof.

Faction.name: {=TAOM_clan_k1}Zulkârim
Faction.text: {=TAOM_clan_k1_desc}The Zulkârim serves as the eyes and ears of Khand. Their assassins and scouts move unseen through enemy lands, gathering intelligence and eliminating threats to the realm.

Faction.name: {=TAOM_clan_k2}Razûlak
Faction.text: {=TAOM_clan_k2_desc}The Razûlak produces the finest swordsmen in all of Khand. Their curved blades are forged using secret techniques passed down through generations.

Faction.name: {=TAOM_clan_k3}Dorûmak
Faction.text: {=TAOM_clan_k3_desc}The Dorûmak rides the hot winds of Khand. Their swift raids strike without warning and vanish before any pursuit can be mounted.

Faction.name: {=TAOM_clan_rh1}Balchothian
Faction.text: {=TAOM_clan_rh1_desc}The Balchothian fields the heaviest cavalry in all of Rhun. Their armored riders crash through enemy lines like an avalanche of steel, leaving nothing but ruin in their wake.

Faction.name: {=TAOM_clan_rh2}Wainriderian
Faction.text: {=TAOM_clan_rh2_desc}The Wainriderian claims descent from the great warlords of the First Age. Their banner, a golden serpent on crimson, is feared throughout the West.

Faction.name: {=TAOM_clan_rh3}Sagarthian
Faction.text: {=TAOM_clan_rh3_desc}The Sagarthian are the finest horse archers in Rhun. Born in the saddle, they can loose arrows with deadly accuracy at full gallop.
